title: How to Post to Snapchat Stories

steps.title: Open Snapchat.
steps.content: Open Snapchat. Tap the Snapchat app icon, which resembles a white ghost on a yellow background. This will open your main Snapchat page if you're logged in. If you aren't logged into Snapchat, tap LOG IN , then enter your email address (or username) and password.

steps.title: Take a snap.
steps.content: Take a snap. Aim your smartphone's camera at whatever you want to add to your Story, then tap the large "Capture" circle at the bottom of the screen. If you don't like your snap, tap X in the top-left corner of the screen to delete it and take another one. If you want to add a video to your Story, you'll tap and hold the "Capture" circle instead. You can record up to 60 seconds of video.

steps.title: Edit your snap
steps.content: Edit your snap as necessary. If you want to write on your snap, add drawings, or add effects, do so before proceeding.

steps.title: Tap the "Story" icon.
steps.content: Tap the "Story" icon. It's a box-shaped icon with a + sign on it in the bottom-left side of the screen. Tap Add if prompted.

steps.title: Tap the Send icon.
steps.content: Tap the Send icon. It's in the bottom-right corner of the screen. Skip this step on Android.

steps.title: Send a snap to multiple people as well as your Story.
steps.content: Send a snap to multiple people as well as your Story. If you want to send your snap to some of your Snapchat contacts and your Story, do the following: Take a snap. Tap the "Send" arrow in the bottom-right corner. Tap My Story at the top of the page, then tap the names of other people you want to include. Tap the "Send" arrow.
